name: dart-code
description: Dart and Flutter support for Visual Studio Code.

colors.description: Color of closing labels rendered for nested Dart constructs.

dart.closingLabels.description: Whether to show annotations against constructor, method invocations and lists that span multiple lines.

dart.debugSdkLibraries.description: Whether SDK libraries should be marked as debuggable.

dart.debugExternalLibraries.description: Whether external libraries should be marked as debuggable.

dart.sdkPath.description: The location of the Dart SDK to use for analyzing and executing code. If blank, Dart Code will attempt to find it from the PATH environment variable.

dart.sdkPaths.description: An array of strings that are either Dart SDKs or folders that contains multiple Dart SDKs in sub-folders. When set, the version number in the status bar will be clickable to quickly switch between SDKs.

dart.lineLength.description: The maximum length of a line of code. This is used by the document formatter.

dart.insertArgumentPlaceholders.description: Whether to insert argument placeholders during code completions.

dart.showTodos.description: Whether to show TODOs in the Problems list.

dart.reportAnalyzerErrors.description: Offer to report analysis server exceptions when they occur.

dart.allowAnalytics.description: Sends analytics such as startup timings, frequency of use of features and analysis server crashes.

dart.checkForSdkUpdates.description: Checks whether you are using the latest version of the Dart SDK at startup.

dart.pubAdditionalArgs.description: Additional args to pass to pub get and pub upgrade commands (eg. --packages-dir).

dart.runPubGetOnPubspecChanges.description: Automatically runs `pub get` whenever pubspec.yaml is saved.

dart.promptToGetPackages.description: Prompt to get packages when opening a project with out of date packages.

dart.promptToUpgradeWorkspace.description: Prompt to upgrade folders to Workspace Folders when projects are detected in sub-folders.

dart.showLintNames.description: Whether to show the names of linter rules in the problems panel to make it easier to `// ignore:`.

dart.flutterSdkPath.description: The location of the Flutter SDK to use. If blank, Dart Code will attempt to find it from the project folder, FLUTTER_ROOT environment variable and the PATH environment variable.

dart.flutterSdkPaths.description: An array of strings that are either Flutter SDKs or folders that contains multiple Flutter SDKs in sub-folders. When set, the version number in the status bar will be clickable to quickly switch between SDKs.

dart.flutterHotReloadOnSave.description: Whether to automatically send a 'hot reload' request during a Flutter debug session when saving files.

dart.analyzeAngularTemplates.description: Whether to enable analysis for AngularDart templates (requires the angular_analyzer_plugin).

dart.organizeDirectivesOnSave.description: Whether to automatically execute Organize Directives when saving files.

dart.previewDart2.description:
Whether to enable previewing Dart 2.0 functionality such as optional new/const.

true: send --preview-dart-2
false: send --no-preview-dart-2
undefined: do not send a flag

dart.previewExperimentalWindowsDriveLett.description: EXPERIMENTAL: Whether to force Windows drive letters always to uppercase to (hopefully) improve compatibility.

dart.analyzerAdditionalArgs.description:
Additional arguments to pass to the Dart analysis server.
This is a diagnostic setting that should not normally be set.

dart.analyzerDiagnosticsPort.description:
The port number to be used for the Dart analysis server diagnostics.
This is a diagnostic setting that should not normally be set.

dart.analyzerInstrumentationLogFile.description:
The path to a log file for the Dart analysis server built-in instrumentation.
This is a diagnostic setting that should not normally be set.

dart.analyzerLogFile.description:
The path to a log file for the Dart analysis server communication.
This is a diagnostic setting that should not normally be set.

dart.analyzerObservatoryPort.description:
The port number to be used for the Dart analysis server observatory.
This is a diagnostic setting that should not normally be set.

dart.analyzerPath.description:
The path to a custom Dart analysis server.
This is a diagnostic setting that should not normally be set.

dart.flutterDaemonLogFile.description:
The path to a log file for `flutter daemon` communication.
This is a diagnostic setting that should not normally be set.

dart.flutterRunLogFile.description:
The path to a log file for `flutter run` communication.
This is a diagnostic setting that should not normally be set.

dart.flutterTestLogFile.description:
The path to a log file for `flutter test` communication.
This is a diagnostic setting that should not normally be set.

dart.observatoryLogFile.description:
The path to a log file for Observatory communication.
This is a diagnostic setting that should not normally be set.

dart.vmAdditionalArgs.description: Additional args to pass to the Dart VM when running/debugging apps.

dart.flutterSelectDeviceWhenConnected.description: Whether to set newly connected devices as the current device in Flutter projects.

checkedMode.description: Whether to run the VM in checked mode.

program.description: Path to the script to start (eg. bin/main.dart or lib/main.dart).

previewDart2.description:
Whether to enable previewing Dart 2.0 functionality such as optional new/const.

true: send --preview-dart-2

false: send --no-preview-dart-2

null: do not send a flag

showMemoryUsage.description:
Whether to show memory usage for your Flutter app in the status bar during debug sessions (if not set, will automatically show for profile builds).

Note: memory usage shown in debug builds may not be indicative of usage in release builds. Use profile builds for more accurate figures when testing memory usage.

flutterMode.description:
The mode for launching the Flutter application:

debug: Turns on all assertions, includes all debug information, enables all debugger aids and optimizes for fast dev cycles

release: Turns off all assertions, strips as much debug information as possible, turns of debugger aids and optimises for fast startup, fast execution and small package sizes.

profile: Same as release mode exept profiling aids and tracing are enabled.

args.description: Command line arguments to the application.

scripts.test: npm run compile && npm run write_empty_coverage && npm run remap_empty_coverage && npm run instrument && npm run test-only && npm run report_lcov && npm run report_screen
scripts.write_empty_coverage: cd out/src && nyc --all --reporter=none --include out/src echo && cd ../..
